intro: Pedicularis calosantha, commonly known as the showy Indian paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red, orange, or yellow flowers that resemble paintbrushes, which are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can grow up to 30 inches tall. Pedicularis calosantha is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils.
